alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 8:38AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...In Southwest Ohio, Butler County. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 838 AM EDT, While water is receding, there still are some reports of lingering high water on some roadways in portions of Butler County. While rain has moved out of the area, high water will remain into the mid morning hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale, West Chester, Ross, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Dunlap and Wetherington.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
